data.title: Application Data
data.description: Manage your saved data within this application. All data is stored in your browser.
data.favoritesDesc: Manage your saved items and uploaders.
data.worksetsDesc: Manage your saved research worksets and notes.
data.importSuccess: Data imported successfully. The page will now reload.
data.importError: Failed to import data. Please ensure the file is a valid JSON export.
data.confirmClear: Are you sure you want to permanently delete all {{name}} data? This cannot be undone.
data.clearSuccess: {{name}} data cleared. The page will now reload.

about.title: About
about.description: This application is an independent project built using the public APIs of the Internet Archive and powered by Google's Gemini model. It is not an official application of the Internet Archive.

help.title: Help Center
help.subtitle: Find answers to your questions about the Archive Explorer.
help.qSearch: How do I search for items?
help.aSearch: Use the main search bar in the header, which is always available. For more detailed searches, click the filter icon next to the search bar to open the Advanced Search popover. Here you can filter by media type, year, collection, and build complex queries.
help.aFilters: The Advanced Search popover lets you narrow your results. You can select one or more media types, specify a date range, or limit your search to a specific collection. The Query Builder allows for even more specific searches, like finding items by a particular creator or with a certain word in the title.
help.qNav: How do I navigate the app?
help.aNav: Use the side menu (on larger screens) or the bottom navigation bar (on mobile) to jump to the main sections. For the fastest navigation, use the Command Palette (Ctrl/Cmd + K) to instantly go anywhere or perform actions.
help.aExplorer: This is the main dashboard. When you're not actively searching, it shows curated content like 'Trending Now' and 'On This Day in History' to help you discover interesting items. When you perform a search, this view shows your results.
help.aTrending: This section shows items that have been viewed or downloaded the most across the entire Internet Archive in the last week.
help.aOnThisDay: This section shows items that were published on today's date in previous years, offering a historical snapshot.
help.aQuickSearch: These are curated buttons that run a pre-configured search for popular topics like 'Classic Films' or 'Live Concerts', helping you dive into interesting collections quickly.
help.qCinemaAudio: What are the Cinematheque and Audiothek?
help.aCinemaAudio: These are curated landing pages designed for discovering video and audio content, respectively. They feature popular categories and hand-picked collections to browse, rather than just a list of search results.
help.aImages: The Images Hub is a starting point for exploring visual content. You can search for images or browse by featured collections from institutions like NASA and The Met, or by themes like History and Art.
help.aRecRoom: The Rec Room is a portal for emulated software, primarily classic MS-DOS games. You can launch and play these games directly in your browser without needing to download anything.
help.qWebArchive: What can I do with the Wayback Machine?
help.aWebArchive: This tool allows you to see how a website looked in the past. Enter a URL to view a calendar of all the snapshots the Internet Archive has saved over the years.
help.aScriptorium: The Scriptorium is your personal research workspace, designed for working with texts. You can search for documents, group them into 'worksets', and analyze their content.
help.aWorksets: A workset is like a project folder. You can create multiple worksets (e.g., '19th Century Poetry', 'WWII Letters'). While a workset is active, you can add documents to it from search results or the document reader. This helps you organize your research.
help.qReaderAi: What AI tools are available in the reader?
help.aReaderAi: When viewing a text document, you can use AI-powered tools. 'Generate Summary' creates a concise overview of the text, and 'Extract Entities' identifies and lists all the people, places, organizations, and dates mentioned in the document.
help.aUploaderHub: This section showcases the individuals and institutions who contribute content to the Internet Archive. You can browse by category, search for specific uploaders, and see what kind of content they typically share.
help.aFavorites: Click the star icon on any item or uploader to save them to your Favorites page. This is a great way to keep track of things you want to come back to later.
help.aSimilar: When viewing an item's details, this section suggests other items that are likely to be related, usually because they are in the same collection or by the same creator.
help.aDownload: Yes. In the item's detail view, there is a 'Files' or 'Downloadable Files' section that lists all available files for download. Clicking a file will open it in a new tab where you can save it.
help.qOfficial: Is this an official Internet Archive app?
help.aOfficial: No, this is an independent project created as a demonstration of what can be built with the public Internet Archive APIs and Google's AI tools. It is not affiliated with or endorsed by the Internet Archive.
help.qAboutApp: Who built this application and why?
help.aAboutApp: This application was built to showcase the power of modern web technologies and the capabilities of the Gemini model. It serves as an example project within AI Studio, demonstrating how to build a functional, aesthetically pleasing application that integrates with external APIs and AI services. You can view the project and its code in AI Studio.

nav.exploreDesc: Go to the main explore page
nav.favoritesDesc: View your saved items and uploaders
nav.helpDesc: Get help and read the FAQ

actions.toggleThemeDesc: Switch between light and dark mode

jeff_kaplan.description: An archivist specializing in the preservation of classic software and games, ensuring their availability for future generations.

jakej.description: A community uploader focused on digitizing rare and out-of-print books and magazines.

lego_archive.description: Dedicated to archiving historical Lego catalogs, instruction manuals, and related media.

jvaneerden.description: A prolific contributor of live music recordings, especially from the jam band scene.

librivox.description: The official account for LibriVox, a community of volunteers who record audiobooks of public domain texts.
